text: Rosen Kirilov (; born 4 January 1973 in Vidin) is a Bulgarian retired professional footballer who played as a defender, and the manager. He played as a centre-back for the Bulgaria national team, CSKA Sofia, Litex Lovech, Adanaspor, APOP Kinyras and Vaslui. ==Career== Kirilov moved at the age of 18 from Bdin Vidin to CSKA Sofia in 1991. His first competitive game for the club was against Etar Veliko Tarnovo at Ivaylo Stadium on 10 November 1991 which CSKA lost 1–0. Kirilov made 51 appearances for the Bulgarian national team from 1998 to 2006.
